intro: Psychotria castanea, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround its small white flowers, making it a popular ornamental species. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Psychotria castanea is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
